Review.Contenu: To start their products are great, but the customer service is subpar to say the least. Being a company that make firearm safes and claim to support 2A, you would think that the company is for the people. This couldn't be furthest from the truth. On April 26, 2023 i ordered the "smart station" (which on the website showed to be in stock) intended to be a mothers day gift for my wife as she recently joined the 2A family a purchased her first hand gun. Going out of my way to ensure that the product would arrive before Mother's Day, I researched form the company's website that their listed shipping time was estimated to be 5 business days, in turn giving just about 3 weeks for product to reach me. On May 2, 2023 I received an email from vaultek stating..."We wanted to make you aware of a shipping delay. Due to an internal error, we did not adequately display the correct shipping date. The display should have notified you at the time of checkout that all Titanium Gray and Alpine White Smart Stations will ship on, or around, 5/25."Immediately I got in contact with customer service and advised them of the extreme inconvenience this oversight on their part has caused me. The lack of empathy and compassion in which the company displayed towards my hardship was Sicking. I was basically told to go "F" off and wait, and when I requested to speak to a supervisor I was denied. This is a money hungry company who cares nothing about the American people or our right to bear arms. They only care about money, we are nothing but a number to them.

Review.Titre: Cool Idea That Looks Good On Paper.
Review.Contenu: Cool Idea That Looks Good On Paper.Pro's:- Cool Idea and great looks- Supposedly no 'backdoor' access- Customer Service (so far and for myself anyway)Con's- Fingerprint reader (high False Rejection Rate)- Accessory fitments (not optimal and lacking, to say the least)- It's not a safe, more like a glorified storage cabinet like 'Secure-it'---Details Below---I thought I would go all out on an RS safe. It turns out I should have gone bare-bones basic (which is still fairly pricey for what an RS 'safe' is). Shipping was fine and I was excited to install my third attempt at a so-called "safe." Will it keep kids out of it? Probably. Will it keep burglars out of it? Depends. A smart one will get into this thing in no time at all with minimal effort just by going in your garage and grabbing basic tools I'm sure any gun owner would have lying around. So time and noise are always somewhat of a deterrent, of course.When I first received the RS Series - RS800i PLUS Edition, there was a manufacturer defect with the electronics and LEDs. Vaultek CS was on point with return shipping and replacement. Thank you for that. Installing the new unit, I used 4 times longer fasteners and extra wide fender washers, to go into drywall/wood/then concrete, than what was provided. This thing won't be going anywhere now unless it's simply cut open and contents easily removed. Strongly recommend not using included hardware because I don't believe it to be long enough.The main selling point of this safe is probably the fingerprint reader, which is probably the worst and most frustrating thing. 20 different fingerprints are able to be read/programmed with the first two being master prints just case you run a risk of chopping off a finger; or to grant a loved one master access as well. The first testing result yielded horrible odds of a successful read (False Rejection Rate). The instructions do recommend for difficulty with fingerprint reading to program 4 or 5 of the same print to assist in the reader recognizing one print. This solution then leaves 15 to 16 different prints left to program and it still does not yield great results. I was unable to find two fingers I'd prefer to open this 'safe' with 100% accuracy. Not a comforting feeling. After using all 20 programs, I'm still trying to figure out how to let my wife program at least one of hers. We've tried having her program all 20 programs with her fingerprints and yielded similar results. The odds of it accepting the prints are still bad. It may be acceptable if your finger was wet, oily or dirty to get such inaccurate results, but a perfectly dry print yielding around 80% is completely unacceptable for immediate access if need be.Then came the fun part of filling in the 'safe' RS (storage cabinet). The advertisement photos are really misleading (false advertisement) in that they lead you to believe you can fit all the things they show in such a small space. The first issue was fitting the Full Width or 2/3rd Shelf and Pistol Racks inside the upper portion of the safe and fitting the AR Accessory Bundle on the door. When trying this configuration, the shelf sticks out enough to block the area where I would like the Spring Loaded Mount to go. In other words, it will not let you close the door if installed near the same level on the door as the Full Width or 2/3rd Shelf inside the cabinet.IMO there are other misleading photos regarding rifles being installed on the door. There always will be an extra step to getting a firearm ready for use as opposed to 'ready for use.' I'd prefer to have enough room on the door to have a rifle with optic/sights installed and erect and a magazine inserted. Sadly, there is not enough room for both. This will only work with flip up sights being down with a magazine installed and the rifle positioned all the way left on the door. Alternatively, the rifle can have sights/optic installed and erect with no magazine, but the rifle would have to be installed further right on the door panel which may lead to interference with the grip and the door closing. Utilizing the 'ROMEO 5' type optic, the grip touches/interferes with the door. The hope is that when I try to open the door in an emergency, there will be no interference with the grip (which there currently already is).All in all, I'm mostly happy with the product. I hope this constructive criticism is taken to heart. I also feel if all these issues weren't here, only then it might be worth the two thousand dollar price tag.

Review.Titre: Smart Station- great concept, but not ready to launch.
Review.Contenu: Like a lot of people (based on the website crashes to order the second round), I was thrilled to get ahold of a smart station for myself and a friend. My first one was a problem almost out of the box- would basically lock me out just looking at it despite saving 15 different versions of the same finger to unlock it. The keypad was unreliable, and the wireless charger was spotty. I sent it back and got a new unit. Now, the locking mechanism works but the safe has a habit of loudly beeping at us at 3 am every night Until we wake up. My friend reported that his unit barely opens on the initial release. He has to close and then re open for it to fully launch. The smart station is a great concept, but way too many bugs for me. This is supposed to be able to help quickly respond to a possible home emergency, and frankly seems to be fully capable of putting my family in danger more than helping. Vaultek support has been great, and I have appreciated their help but this product just is not ready for market.

Review.Titre: RS800i or any RS model glorified storage cabinet
Review.Contenu: RS800i or any RS model; This is nothing more than a glorified quick access storage cabinet. It's not a safe. And for it to be close to $2,000 China made, it's a complete rip off. The front is hardly "safe" quality and is very similar to the SecureIt storage cabinets. The unit is also only thin metal and nothing more than the same thin metal as the cabinets in my garage. Anyone with lack of brains and a small crowbar or angle grinder would get into this so called "safe" very quickly without the code or fingerprint (biometric) scanner. This industry really need standardization in what companies are allowed to call a safe, and this is not it. My experience with this "safe" is I thought maybe because of a Black Friday deal I'd bite the expensive bullet and give a quick access "safe" a try. After opening the box, I'm sadly disappointed in realizing how poor quality this glorified storage cabinet is. Reading the instructions and programming the unit, I noticed more than half of the LEDs do not work. Once again, I was duped off of a Chinese made P.O.S... Now I am returning the unit and I don't even want a replacement, the lack of security and quality are really not worth the hefty price tag.

I was able to open the safe with the key no problems there. However when I put in the master code it I get a message “unlock granted” but then it reads “status: locked.” (This was after I put the battery in and plugged the unit in). Unplug the safe and removed battery same problem. Called NW Safes and their “tech” said to watch YouTube videos of how to program the safe. Okay…. So to summarize I paid 1500 plus for a safe that I can only open up with a key (which I am now dubious if it will work correctly in the future given the problems with the electronics). Again to iterate, I opened the safe with the key, put the battery in, with the door open used the master code to change the passcode. It recognizes the  master passcode but the status still says locked and when I try to reset the passcode via vaulteks’ prescribed method I get a Tamper Warning message. Oh and there is no way for me to contact somebody from Vaultek to resolve the issue. Save your money, time, and firearms and look to a more reputable safe maker.

But it was the same result. It just doesn’t hold up.
The unit is solid, BUT the finger printing software is less than desirable.  I had to resort to using / leaving the mechanical key to confidently open the unit.

The product has great design and feature, however, not sure about reliability. My Smart Station died after only about 6 months. Bought it in May of this year and it won't turn on at all in at the end of November. Not sure what happened but had complete power failure.

Review.Titre: I have 3 RS800i in 3 differnt homes…
Review.Contenu: I have 3 RS800i in 3 differnt homes along with a multitude of other Vaultek safes....so I love the product but I cant get the latest RS800 to connect to the internet in the new home even though other Vaultek safes in that same home and location will and I havent had time to call vaultek :(

Again, fed ex delivery was delayed. My package was on a truck for days with no delivery attempts. Vaultek should offer more delivery options with other carriers such as UPS. Giving us only one method of delivery makes vaultek responsible for delays as customers have no choice but only trusts delivery will be on time.

Review.Titre: I woke up early in the morning to…
Review.Contenu: I woke up early in the morning to secure a spot and I did. Received it rather quick very nice looking unit unfortunately the most important part of the safe does not work which is the sliding tray it does not fully eject and that means i cant get my weapon out properly i have to angle it.

Review.Titre: Still waiting to receive my purchase…
Review.Contenu: Your website listed a product “in-stock” and therefore I purchased it. Several days later, I received an email stating the safe would ship much later than anticipated due to a “shipping date error.” Had I known the actual shipping/stock status I would have waited to purchase, as I could have used the money for other expenses. And, I then receive an email to review my purchase when it hasn’t even shipped.  I’m sure the safe is a good product, but very disappointing purchasing experience.

The case is not deep enough to use the tray with a compact gun. The biometrics did not work on my safe when setting up the case. I guess I will just use the keyboard to access the case. Too much of a hassle to send back. The other products I purchased in the past worked fine.

Review.Titre: I never heard about a delay in…
Review.Contenu: I never heard about a delay in processing - had to email to find out it still won't ship for another 2 weeks and will miss the birthday gift timeline we had planned. That should be stated somewhere when purchasing. UPDATE: Talked with tech support and they are resolving the issue quickly - much appreciated.

For the price of the unit I am very disappointed. The keypad functionality is poor, multiple attempts to enter the biometrics and the unit fails to recognize my fingerprint the majority of the time. The optional Bluetooth release button does not function more than half the time and is within 3ft of the unit. If I could I would get my money back. The wireless charging, light in the safe compartment, and the charging ports all function as they should. These are the only reason I did not leave a 1 star review.

A simple piece of small plastic handle had to not only be bought separately but shipped additionally?  Really?Makes for an awkward gift wrap when I’m giving this as a gift to a client.Invest in repackaging, and for the already expensive price, include it!

Review.Titre: Cable can easily be cut with bolt…
Review.Contenu: Cable can easily be cut with bolt cutters.  To many steps to open non biometric models.  Not enough color options for biometric version.  Overall, it's a below average product that's disappointing. I purchased six of these vaults this month - 3 via the company's website, 1 from Amazon and 2 via Costco Next... avoid Amazon at all costs because it arrived and was clearly used. Avoid Costco because they only sell limited versions and colors and none of the biometric models.  Ultimately, I will keep 4 of them -- returned the one that arrived used and one from Costco --  but hope for improvements for future versions and that the company will address these issues to make it a great product.  Good concept though.

I've had this safe for about 3 years and overall it is a good, solid, gun safe. However, for the last 3 months I've been having issues with the power and being able to open with biometrics or keypad. I discovered the charging cable won't stay connected to the charging port unless you manipulate it by hand. Even then, it is very touchy. It's like the charging port is damaged somehow. I tried 3 different cables just to make sure that isn't the issue. I now have a safe that I can only open using the physical key. It's out of warranty, so I have a $270 brick.

Review.Titre: The biometric system is very poor
Review.Contenu: The biometric system is very poor. The companies solution is to have you enter the same fingerprint under multiple users to allow for the slightest variances to pick up your print. I have the same fingerprint under five users and still can’t get into my safe without the code. Both models that I own have the same problem. If you need quick access/entry this is not the safe for you.

I purchased a safe via Vaultek’s website on Feb 15. After hours of trying, the website continued to crash or freeze up, I was able to purchase and received a confirmation. A week later I called to find out the status of my order and after 15 minutes was told there was a glitch on that day and they didn’t have enough quantity to fulfill the orders and I wouldn’t be receiving my safe till the next shipment arrived, nearly a month later. Supposedly a email was sent explaining what happened but I never received it. Finally got a email 10 days later explaining the situation and offering 5% discount for my wait. Terrible experience and poor customer service.

Your ordering system. Received emails twice on inventory coming available at specific time/date only to try the first time and never got through. The second time inventory became available at specific/time-date I was kicked out multiple times. Finally got into website and it said I could order 2 safes which I did. Put in CC INFO PLUS ALL SHIPPING INFO…. only to find out days later that I didn’t get the product because you didn’t have the inventory you were selling. I have since received emails that best case I will potentially receive product in May 2023 “but still don’t know) I have tried to order this product since last Fall for gifts, been put on email notifications mutiple times. I am a return customer, but pretty frustrated with the experiences of trying to get these 2 safes.
I spent $900 on 3 products and I have tried to email customer service 2 times and no one ever replies. I'm tired of sending emails, it shouldn't be this difficult to get a hold of someone....

1> POOR. The instructions on the overall assembly are very poor.2> Even though I'm a professional network engineer, I am unable to set up wireless connectivity. It is very frustrating.3> There is NO listing of the customer support contact number.4> Considering the cost of the product and the additional shipping cost of $100, we as a consumer expect better quality of the product & after sale service.

Review.Titre: After being the victim of the first…
Review.Contenu: After being the victim of the first website crash, I contacted support to ask if steps were being taken to prevent a similar occurrence. I was given assurances that steps were being taken and new processes and equipment put in place to handle the increased traffic to the website during the special period for those of us who requested to be notified when the product became available again. At least this time I was able to complete the purchase process. Or so I thought, received an email that they somehow sold more units than they had. Not sure how that’s possible. I was then given and option of waiting, taking the product but in a different color than I had purchased or cancelling my order. I chose the different color unit but received no confirmation from Vaultek that they received my email. Had to call to confirm they received it. No idea when I will see my order but I’m praying it’s as good as I’ve heard given the amount of problems getti NB it has been.

I bought the Vaultek 10 series Aug 2022 and had issues with  opening the safe using my PIN. I had to reset my pin a few times in order to fixed the issue. Not a reliable safe if you are in emergency situation and need to retrieve your gun. I would not recommend.

After placing my order and having my account charged I was informed that due to an internal error there would be a shipping delay of 3 1/3 weeks before the item would be available. Knowing this at the time of purchase would have been fine, finding it out afterwards was a disappointment.

Review.Titre: My pistol safe opened in the middle of…
Review.Contenu: My pistol safe opened in the middle of night while i was sleeping and it said it was from a key entry. There was no else in the house and I'm the only with the key. Also the clock/ display dims for some reason

Review.Titre: Nothing Is wrong with the item but the…
Review.Contenu: Nothing Is wrong with the item but the hype and build up of this product was a let down! Packaging was nice. Color was nice but space inside very tight. I can't even fit the tray because my weapon has a magwell and the tray doesn't even work.

Barikade arrived (3/27) in an unusable state. Customer service (3/28) was kind and helpful, and offered a replacement. However it has been about a week and a half maybe two and it has not arrived, nor have I received tracking info.  Will call back soon to confirm. Not the end of the world, but I’m disappointed I have to go through all of this, just to get a product that works.Update:(4/8 I think) customer service was again very kind and helpful, and when notified the shipment hadn’t gone out, it was shipped the next day. However, they mailed out an entirely different product. Upon contacting customer service again (4/13), I learned this was an intentional effort to send me an upgrade. The problem is that the upgrade is a larger safe, which doesn’t suit my needs. Customer service was once again kind and helpful, offering for me to keep the product, and sell me a new Barikade for 30% off. I thought that was a good deal, and I’ve taken it. Hopefully, the new Barikade arrives with no further issue.

Let’s start at the beginning. Well safe I really wanted was listed on we sight however none in stock. That’s cool no big deal. So ordered a different life pod 2.0. Wait a week and get the wrong safe. Had to work hard to find customer service. After finally finding it waited another week to get safe. However my fault I didn’t look inside the box to make sure I had all the pieces. I sent the other safe back un opened and then realized the safe I got did not come with the organizer like described. The safe works like advertised but the company does not seem to be running that well. I guess my second VAULTEK safe with be my last.

Just purchased the 7th unit,LifePod X, Sent 2 Emails to you Folks about the problem.. NO ANSWER FROM THEM and could not find a Telephone number to call you Folks.. All the rest of the units work GREAT.. So if you get this message, please call me :  302-539-3233..Thank You

This rating is for our RS800i. We’ve had it exactly one week as of 3/16/23. Took a week to arrive from order date. Safe arrived a day after the Plus addition accessories even though they shipped together, got separated in transit, no big deal there. Aesthetically appealing, great storage, great accessories, Biometrics are fine and the safe is secure enough for the PewPews. The Wi-FI…the damn Wi-Fi. Connected just fine, no issues. Good for about a day. I bought a new router thinking that may be the problem, no luck. Ordered a new modem from Xfinity that arrived today, still no luck. I can connect to the safe just fine. The second the screen goes dark, Wi-Fi disconnects. I’ve moved the router and modem closer. I’ve moved the safe 3 times to avoid walls interfering with the signal with no joy. A little frustrating to say the least. For a $2,300+ safe, I expect the technology to work. If I could’ve bought this safe locally I’d probably return it (would’ve saved a pretty penny on shipping too). I’ll deal, but it’s disappointing. I also ordered 2 LifePod 2.0 w/ Biometric safes at the same time, and they’re fantastic. The RS series may need a few tweaks.

Review.Titre: Like all products in the LifePod series…it's unusable
Review.Contenu: Like all products in the LifePod series, the LifePod 2.0 is just a fraction small in all dimensions. I bought two of the Colion Noir version with the leather organizer. The EDC tray is worthless if your gun is more than 1" wide. My P365 fits fine by itself. Put a light on it, and it's too wide. I must bend the EDC tray over the light to shut it. My P320? Not with the EDC tray. Don't put small items in the mesh pocket, unless you enjoy putting them back in after toting it around for 30 seconds. This design failure should be fixed by putting a zipper on it and making the EDC tray about 1/4" less deep. Then you probably have a usable product that fetches 4 or 5 stars.

Updated 6/22/23: Apparently the quick reply that someone from their "5 Star Review Team" would be reaching out soon works about as well as the product does... It's been a week since they replied and crickets!!   Updated 6/13/23:  Now that I've used this safe for around a month, I wanted to update.  I'm very disappointed!!  The fingerprint sensor SUCKS!  I would hate to think I had an intruder and need to rely on this.  I've set my finger print multiple multiple times (not a typo) and the best results I've had was being able to open it after 4 attempts! (and it's usually 8-10).  I use my fingerprint on an iPad and it works perfectly.  Now on to the wireless charging... I have an iPhone 13 Pro Max and it has to be just perfect in order to charge.  For a $500 safe... it should work much better!!The website, ease of purchase, and shipping updates were fantastic. For a suggestion... I would make the clock have an alarm clock feature and it's already Bluetooth, why not have a Bluetooth speaker built in!  Not only would it add functionality, but it would also disguise the unit better.

Review.Titre: The biometric scanner on the safe does…
Review.Contenu: The biometric scanner on the safe does not work well.  Also your phone has to be place just right to charge you phone so I done use it.  I have multiple VAULTEK products and I am very disappointed with this one.

Review.Titre: SR20i that I received is thin sheet…
Review.Contenu: The SR20i that I received is thin sheet metal box. Don't trust it, other than to keep the kids out of it.  I don't think it qualifies as a gun storage box.

Review.Titre: The finger print access was working…
Review.Contenu: The finger print access was working great the first day but the very next day didn’t work, tried placing finger in different positions about 40 times still nothing

Review.Titre: The fingerprint reader is a pile of $ h…
Review.Contenu: The fingerprint reader is a pile of $ h 1 t Works okay for me after scanning the same finger twice which equals 10 scans.  Junk.  My wife. We tried 4 slots or 20 total scans and it only opened once the. Never again.  Guess she’ll need to remember a number or find a key.

Review.Titre: The safe itself is awesome but using…
Review.Contenu: The safe itself is awesome but using the Wi-Fi option does not work with a darn
Batteries simply don’t last They should have a mid size vault that can handle 12 to more hand guns…but that’s me.

Review.Titre: Safes key pad and biometric worked for…
Review.Contenu: Safes key pad and biometric worked for a few house now will not light up at all. Must use key to open.  I’m planning on a return as soon as I get back in town.
What is the point of having a clock next to your bed without an alarm.  Don’t go and say you can use your phone so people don’t like to do that. It would’ve been very simple to add that feature.

The package came in original boxes packed in a soft envelope, the boxes were crushed and not reusable. Care should have been taken during delivery. I was going to give them as gifts but can't as they look like second hand items not reconditioned.

Review.Titre: I don't like the design and couldn't…
Review.Contenu: I don't like the design and couldn't get the finger print to work

Review.Titre: Print reader is inconsistent at best
Review.Contenu: Print reader is inconsistent at best.  I would never rely on it for access.

Review.Titre: Better than most, lots of room for improvement.  Expensive.  Customer service not 45 star
Review.Contenu: First of all, I have spent a ton of money with Vaultek over the last 30 days - an RS800, RS200, MX, and a Slider Series - including a few hundred dollars in extra accessories - a total of over $4500.  So I think I'm pretty qualified to have an opinion.  My Amazon experience was terrible - 2 of the 3 products showed up / 1 was a misshipment and took Amazon 40 days to resolve / refund.  When I ordered the RS800 there were FedEx issues (not Vaultek's issue) and their support wasn't extremely helpful in tracking it down.  Eventually it showed up.Bottom line - I think this is a good product and in some ways better than competing products.  But I have a list of constructive criticism / feedback that is impossible to share with Vaultek as they don't provide email contact addresses or ways to solicit feedback - other than this review.  I did not want to leave a 2 star review as I would have rather provided detailed feedback / suggestions in a more anonymous way.  Bottom line, their mobile app "strategy" is ridiculous as I have to have 3 different apps to manage / monitor 4 different safes.  The fingerprint readers are low quality / don't work very well, and many of the accessories don't work as well as designed.  The upside is I still think this is a better product than alot of what I've seen.  It seems very overpriced for a non-fireproof safe.  The tech is basic and seems non-upgradable.  I've got more comments but hopefully this gets someone's attention.  I would probably buy another RS800 but I just don't think it's worth what they are charging.

Review.Titre: I recieved 2 safes when I thought I…
Review.Contenu: I recieved 2 safes when I thought I ordered 1. Can I send one back?

Review.Titre: Shipping is free at other distributors
Review.Contenu: Just finally bought the RS800i plus and still waiting on it . Waited a long time to order since wasn’t available. I feel ripped off since I can get it for the same price at say Armadillo safes and get free shipping instead of over 225 dollars to ship. Wish I had seen it before I ordered from here they just got it back in stock as well. Other spots are veteran owned my fault I should have looked harder

I love almost everything about this safe. It is built very rugged and handles lots of abuse. It is not open to being attacked by drops or easy pry attacks. The software is robust and well protected. My only complaint is the keyway. Most of the safes have the same key which is very easy to pick with a low level of skill. I wish it had a more robust key such as an abloy. I cannot upgrade the lock mechanism due to it being in a welded area.

I secured it behind my front passenger seat. Now I can let my seat won’t go all the way back.  I’m going to have to figure something else. Also the safe operates smoothly but with that it rattles a lot when driving.I had to totally remove it from my car and just use it as a house safe at this point. Having trouble getting it to connect to the app. Very disappointed with this safe.

Purchased this 4 months ago and am not particularly impressed. Biometrics might work 30% of the time, at best, which is very discouraging to think about a break-in scenario. Alarm is too sensitive to external bumps or vibrations. My phone playing music, while sitting on top, will set off the alarm. Lastly, for the money, this safe fills up very quickly. $550 did not go far in terms of space.

I bought their premium model with fingerprint scanner, phone unlock, keyfob etc. The positive is that the safe is made solid and heavy for a handgun safe. The negative is that their fingerprint technology sucks. Doesnt work 99 percent of the time. Need to use keypad most times to access it. I would recommend them, just go with a cheaper model that is strictly keypad. The fingerprint is a waste and the keyfob is an unnecessary gizmo.

Review.Titre: I was not pleased with the dimensions…
Review.Contenu: I was not pleased with the dimensions they did not line up with the guns the website said the safe could hold.

Review.Titre: Ive only had the bag for maybe 2 months…
Review.Contenu: Ive only had the bag for maybe 2 months and the handle ontop ripped. I don't hold it by the handle very often either,  so i was surprised when it ripped. The bag over all is nice, but i wish i could get it replaced. For how much the bag was it should be stitched better.

Review.Titre: Had higher expectations for the price
Review.Contenu: Had higher expectations for the price. The light does not stay on long enough.  The finger print reader is horribly unreliable.  If you’re betting your life on it working you will lose that bet.  I expected a much stronger wall thickness and locking mechanism. I was disappointed on both fronts.  An amateur thief could pop this safe open with common burgurlary tools. It will do for a night stand box to lock up while you’re home but will not use for primary security.  For the price I expected a much more robust safe.

Review.Titre: I had high hopes for this safe
Review.Contenu: I had high hopes for this safe. It was replacing a Gunvault I have had for years. The overall concept is great except for one thing...it is too SMALL! Standard sized guns do not fit. They were short by about a 1/4". Come on vaultek only a 1/4" and my 1911 would have fit in it.

I loved this safe at first but I've had it for about a year and the finger print reader has gotten worse at unlocking in a timely manner. It takes 2 to 3 try before it opens and in a emergency I would not be able to rely on it...Sad it had so much going for it for a while.

Ordered safe for Christmas present (14 days prior to Christmas) and because Vaultek sent as parcel package via USPS it did not arrive until December 26. I would think they could send via a more reliable service especially since they were promoting purchase for Christmas.

Review.Titre: Battery sucks.. customer service no help
Review.Contenu: It is a great safe but the battery sucks. I purchased the VTI PRO in camo, set it up with a full charge, it died in 11 days. Fully charged again with provided equipment again and the charge only lasted 15 days. For an almost $400 safe I would expect the battery to last what they claim at about 3 months. Very dissatisfied, already contacted customer service and the conclusion was to not use the smart key because it drains the battery?!!!! What!!?? Don’t use the equipment that comes with the almost $400 safe because it drains the battery?!?!?! You are out of your mind!! Make the battery last longer, give a better battery, or provide the info that it will drain the battery if you use the provided equipment.
The biometric scanner only works if your finger goes in exactly how you did when programming. Just a tad off, and you are playing till the finger. Don’t buy the Bio. Keypad is fine.

Review.Titre: Honestly not really worth the money.
Review.Contenu: The smart safe is cool but the mag charger doesn’t work, case , no case , flipped directions doesn’t matter it will be sitting there for like 2 minutes then start beeping and not charging. It’s also a bedside clock with no alarm clock? Doesn’t make much sense to me but whatever.Other than that, holds stuff and the slide works great and tells the time.

The production descriptions are pictures are deceptive, to be more specific, when you utlize the shelves it makes it impossible to run an AR mount on the door. The door will not close and the shelving options are lacking. Non-existing 1/2 shelves for the "top of the line RS800i" makes for awkward pistol configurations. It would be nice to have a 1/2 shelf (or smaller) to run single pistol racks from top to bottom along one side and allow AR mounts. I do own multiple Vaultek safes but this will be my last if i keep it all.
The battery displays different percentages since day 1. Charged it fully followed instructions but will show 40% then 90% seconds after each other. Not happy for the price I paid.

Review.Titre: Had mine for about a year
Review.Contenu: Had mine for about a year. Keypad broke and fingerprint reader works  about 1 in 10 times. So I have to leave it open with loaded gun in the closet
Not as expected. Looks like a simple vault.
Battery dies every 2 days .. on the screen battery life is always 100% , very unsatisfied. I paid 525$ for a product that doesn’t work

Review.Titre: Disappointed Profoundly.  Can't trust the biometric scanner.
Review.Contenu: So, it doesn't fit in my Mitsubishi Endeavor with the optional extra mounting kit.  Okay, these things happen, the safe still seems secure enough to discourage casual thieves, and it's still easy access with the somewhat ridiculous mounting rig I had to set up - however, I asked a friend to try to get in - I didn't say to use a print or type a code... They touched the print scanner *accidentally* while touching buttons for the code and the safe slid open.  The reason I chose this model was that I (erroneously, naively perhaps) thought the print scanner was secure and I could get to the gun if I needed to while sitting in the car - I have a few other vaultek safes, and I turned on dual authentication immediately after seeing the safe just open for this random print.  Since it doesn't keep the gun secure to my satisfaction with only the print used to open it (because if you ever need to get it quickly you may not have the opportunity to blindly type a 6-8 digit code using only 5 different possible numbers)... I'm disappointed.  No more Vaultek products for me.

Review.Titre: I bought the RS800i from Scheels in…
Review.Contenu: Update 2023. I will leave my stars because of the inordinate amount of time I spent to fix this issue.  My new safe works correctly and is what I hoped it would be. But customer service made this an exceptionally painful process to get what I ordered….a functioning safe. Update March 30th.  The safe is failing again and I am marking down my review from 5 stars to 1.  Customer service is responsive but they are not wanting to provide a permanent fix to my safe...only the cheapest way they can and kick the can down the road. They are sending another battery and charge cord.  Something is frying those but they really don't want to fix the safe properly.  At $1800 I cannot recommend the safe with all these problems. The safe has had an alarm go off in the middle of the night twice this week and several times since I bought it back in December.  I will update again once we see if the battery was the culprit all along or if they manage to time out my warranty with these ridiculous fixes.I bought the RS800i from Scheels in Colorado Springs.  It is perfect for what I need and I love the text updates when the safe is opened or moved as well as the biometrics.  I had an issue with low power mode toggling and sending multiple texts and setting off the alarm.  I contacted customer support and they always answered right away.  They diagnosed the power cable as the culprit (I leave it plugged in all the time) and they sent me a new one right away.  Put the new power cable on and it works perfect.  In this day and age, customer support is lacking with many companies.  Vaultek is on the ball and I highly recommend their products.  I also own a pistol box and love it as well.

Review.Titre: So I got the RS500i and it is a great…
Review.Contenu: So I got the RS500i and it is a great safe. It looks great, easily customizable, and seems secure. I'm giving it two stars only because the technology is lacking for the price paid. What exactly is the point of Wifi? My other Vaultek safes using bluetooth allowed me to open the safe using the app. I cannot do this with the RS500i. Also why can I not set the light to stay on until either I close the safe or for more than like 20 seconds? And the notifications are crazy! I don't need a notification when "I" open or close the safe. How about a notification when a user other than the admin opens the safe? I know I opened the safe cause I just did it! Why can't we customize our alerts/notifications?  The app is preset taking away our choices.  And why doesn't the keypad and/or display light up when I come near it? I have to push a number button to get activity, then I get a tamper warning. These are all things you debated about in development meetings but chose to disregard. Amazingly, my complaints are along the same lines as others.  Anyway, this is a $1200 dollar safe but is not worth that price. Adding WiFi gives you the ability to charge more, but there was way more functionality using just bluetooth. Great, I can check my safe's status from afar but that's it.  Yeah, WiFi...woo hoo!!! And your video shows this awesome app on a desktop computer. Where is that? I can't find it in the app store? And i'm just guessing here, but I imagine there is no update ability on the safe even though there is WiFi? Just tossing that out there as a hmm???

Review.Titre: Units are OK but would not buy again…
Review.Contenu: Units are OK but would not buy again without some changes.I really like the size and functionality of both the Slider series and the MX series safe and the safes were easy to program/setup. However, several issues make me regret buying them and will prevent me from buying any more or recommending the devices until upgrades are made and problems addressed.First, while the key fob and the push button devices work well, in our experience with both of these safes, the biometric sensors fail to recognize user fingerprints more than 75% of the time on the first attempt, despite calibrating and reprogramming the fingerprints numerous times. This is particularly problematic for the slider gun safe which is supposed to provide immediate access to the gun in a time of need. Second, despite configuring the devices multiple ways, the battery life for these units are horrible, even when we purchased the backup power packs and charged/used them according to the instructions. We have had the units just under a month and the power packs approximately 2 weeks and both units and battery packs have had to be charged twice because they went dead. All in all, I love the idea behind both of these devices, which is why we spent nearly $1000 on them in the last month; however, I would not recommend them to anyone, particularly at this price point, without the manufacturer addressing these issues because they defeat the purpose of having units you can quickly access if you can't get to the contents because the units are dead or they biometric sensors are not functioning properly.
Sent me a defective unit.  Would not program a new code.

Too many issues all around. I ordered the MX series safe with Wifi and overall am generally satisfied with the safe. My only issue comes from the alarm feature. It is too quiet to be an effective alarm. It can only be heard if you are in the same room withing a few feet and at that point you already know what it happening with the safe. Defeats the purpose. Similarly, other security features like the manual unlock alarm only alarms for about 20 seconds before being quiet again. Excellent. If I catch the event 20 seconds after it happened we're good. My main issues comes from the accessories. I bought the Bio-metric Smart Lock and the Battery Pack. Bio-metric Smart Lock:I'm not really sure what the deal is with this thing. I had no issues setting it up and it reads fingerprints decently well. Sometimes take an attempt or two that I accredit to poor programming on my part. However, I have it mounted so that I can always keep it plugged in. But when the battery is fully charged and plugged in, the scanner does not work. It will show a green success light that my fingerprint is approved but won't open the safe. Maybe one in every 20 scans will open the safe. As soon as I unplug it, it works 100% of the time. I guess you can't keep it plugged in like the manual suggests. The Battery Pack:Actual trash. Claims it will add 3-4 Months of battery to your safe depending on the safe. How about 2 weeks.I charged the unit 100% and charge my safe 100%. Plugged the battery into the safe and 2 weeks later get a notification that my safe has entered low battery mode (when it get's unplugged). Sure enough the battery pack is dead. Recharged and plugged back in, got about 8 days this time.Summary: As long as you don't buy the life-pod, the safes seems to be of great quality and function. The accessories are mere gimmicks at this point. Unless I got "lucky" and got 2 dud accessories at the same time.
It's an OK safe, over priced

Review.Titre: Went from 4 stars to 2 after owning for a while
Review.Contenu: When I first got my RS 500 I would have given it 41/2 stars but now only 2. What bothers me may not matter to others. I ordered my vault from a local shop where I could pick it up and save shipping and then ordered some accessories from Vaultek. One of the accessories was a 2-pistol rack and shelf bundle. Comes with two of the 2-pistol modules that you can also put AR mags in. When I got my vault and put in the modules that came with it along with my extra ones I thought it was good except for one thing. My pistols did not fit down in the module way I thought and were a little wobbly. I was a bit bothered by this but figured they would not fall out so ok. One day I was moving things around a bit and somehow accidentally discovered that there is a little plastic “shelf” in the bottom of the module and if you lift out the foam and remove that shelf the pistols slide down in that foam perfectly! Would have been nice to know. But leave that shelf in for the ar mags. If that was anywhere in the manual I missed it. Well fast forward and I needed more pistol storage so I went to the Vaultek site and now they have 3-pistol modules! Great. Got a couple. Now here is where Vaultek loses their stars. Got the new modules and was moving things around when I realized, for the first time, that the pegboard that you attach the modules to (the big selling point and whole purpose of this vault) does not go all the way to the bottom. Which would be no big deal except it’s about 18” short and plenty of space to put another module or two. This space then is basically worthless except where you have your rifles. If you only had rifles and a couple pistols above them you would never know. Well for me this was a huge bummer because I had a module I would have like to put there but no place for it. Well I figured there was an easy solution and that is the fact that the 2-pistol and 3-pistol (and new 4-ar mag module) are identical except for the foam insert. So I would contact Vaultek to get a couple 3-pistol foam inserts to replace a couple of my 2-pistol ones and I could get enough to mitigate the loss of that bottom 18”. Customer service answered quickly to my inquiry about buying a couple foam inserts (don’t need more modules!) and, of course, don’t have them available. I know how manufacturers and suppliers work and Vaultek probably gets all this pre assembled from their supplier but they could easily order some separate foam inserts. But would rather sell you a $40 module than a $10 insert. And I didn’t ask but I’m pretty sure I could not get a longer pegboard which should already be in there.

I bought 2, 1 with Biometrics, 1 without.  Securing your firearms is a responsibility all owners should practice.About the safes:  They are good-looking, but while the shell is hard, it's not metal.  I've also seen videos where the electronics and the physical aspects were defeated pretty quickly.  BUT in a home situation, these are adequate, and able to prevent young hands from reaching those firearms.  I don't regret the purchases!

Bought the SliderSeries. Pretty good Safe. Altought it doesn‘t quite fit the Walther PDP FS 4.5“. Also the Biometric Fingerprint System could be better. You don‘t have multiple positions for Fingerprint-Registration, so if you want to open the Safe you have to put your Finger in the exact Position you‘ve registrated it.

I am not happy with the way the safe is working ... it stops charging the phone after a set time vs until the phone is completely charged.  Also, most times when the safe is opened...the time on the clock goes away and I have to go back into settings to add it back.  I need to coordinate problems with Vaultek to get these things corrected or replace device.

The safe is well made, but the tray doesn't work well with the foam in it. There is either to much foam with the tray making it hard to close or not enough foam without the tray letting my  gun slide around.

Review.Titre: wish the app can do more!
Review.Contenu: i was hopping that the app would give me more control of the safe. it is limited to monitor and not manage settings.

Review.Titre: This 20 Series Not As Good As My First
Review.Contenu: Early this year I purchased a 20 Series (VE20) and a Lifepod (LVP10).  Quality of both was great.  Today I received another 20 Series (VS20i - Alpine White).  This safe is not so good.  The left side of the lid has an obvious area where the paint is chipped off (1/4” x 3/4”), and when unlocked the lid would not open by itself.  The one latch was bent and I needed to put a shim under the one side of the latch so it would clear the locking mechanism when opened.  A safe like this should never have left the plant.  I needed to use it otherwise I would have returned it.
Safe is good but the fingerprint feature is simply not reliable enough. Often takes 2 or 3 attempts to open.

Review.Titre: Product arrived in good shape and…
Review.Contenu: Product arrived in good shape and ontime...no issues there. The clock feature randomly turns off so you have to open the app to adjust setting to turn it back on. Also, you get this random beeping or alarm when the phone is charging. Not sure if it's a sensor or what but would love to know what the heck is causing it. Otherwise the drawer opens and secures your pistol and any other valuables as advertised.

Review.Titre: Sturdy and responsive box, but questionable cable
Review.Contenu: The box itself feels very sturdy. The keypad is responsive to touch. My fully charged rechargeable AA battery doesn’t appear to last long before it needs to be replaced, which makes me wonder if the lockbox requires more energy to use than anticipated. The security cable seems too small and fine for properly tether the box in my truck - my fear is that it can easily be cut.

The safe is great. The purchase was not so good. Purchased from Amazon thought I was getting RS800i safe. Recieved RS500i Vaultek safe when I spoke to Amazon the said I ordered RS800i safe. But the company that sent the safe said it was RS500i safe I ordered. Thought the whole thing was bull and kept the RS500i safe. The safe itself is very good no problems even ordered some accessories.

Review.Titre: Good but not excellent considering the price.
Review.Contenu: I could be missing something, but the door on my safe only open to 90 degrees.  With accessories and equipment hanging on the door it makes access to the items inside difficult.  They should make the door open 180 degrees or more.  I've also had issues getting my fingerprint (biometric) to work properly.  Vaultek customer service has been very active in helping me try to solve this problem.

Review.Titre: You need two hands to open the air…
Review.Contenu: You need two hands to open the air tight latches and even then they are finicky without a bunch of practice. Seems like overkill for such a small and "travel friendly" container. This product may have spread itself thin imo. Love my Slider but this model is not a good travel version of what the Slider provides in terms of quick stowing or access.

Good safe, lots of room, well thought out accessories for customizing the interior. Display is clear and remote communication between safe and cell phone is a cool novelty. Especially letting you know if someone is trying to access the safe. The only real drawback is the fingerprint reader is garbage. Never reads my finger correctly so I alwayss have to use the code to get in. As this was one of the main reasons for purchasing this is a big dissappointment.

The instructions for starting the set-up process were confusing as well as attaining the App for the iPhone.  There are way too many apps on the App Store for Vaultek and when I finally said heck with it and downloaded what I thought was the correct App I was able to walk through the setup process without instructions.

Review.Titre: Shipping was fast as always, but some issues
Review.Contenu: Shipping was fast as always, quality of the products is great. Unfortunately some of the products I bought have an unreliable fingerprint reader (I own multiple products from them, and not all have the same issue). Also one of the boxes arrived damaged, but the product was intact inside. One other thing is that the external fingerprint reader that I bought not long ago it is not compatible with their last released product.

Review.Titre: FedEx delivered the safe a day late let…
Review.Contenu: FedEx delivered the safe a day late let than they said. Safe seems nice and secure and  the lock picking lawyer says it’s better than most. Wish it wasn’t made in China though.

Review.Titre: Slider is Good not Great for the money
Review.Contenu: Overall the Slider is a well designed product, but they stop at good versus being great! Design not completely thought through for home use, as all safes of this size should have a cable lock system. Most people do not want to screw into their nice furniture and it does not have ability to install on the posterior side of safe.They offer a Universal Mount(has a cable lock) that I bought for car but do not feel I should buy additional one for home. Engineers need to fully understand homeowners needs if they want to have the best safe available.

Overall I really like the smart station. The only disappointment with it is the wireless charger- which was a big selling point. I have three other wireless charges I use regularly. This is the only one that does not work with my phone’s case and is extremely finicky as to where I place the phone.

I don’t plan to return it, but it is lacking in a few areas. Mainly the fingerprint scanner. It’s not very reliable. In addition to the fingerprint scanner, the locking cable in the rear can sometimes prevent the drawer from closing all the way, the temp/humidity is wildly inaccurate, and the wireless phone charging can get a little finicky at times. If this was a couple hundred cheaper then this would be a great value based on what I received. But at this price point, I think it’s middle of the road at best and needs some work.

Review.Titre: Full size grip  guns with or without…
Review.Contenu: Full size grip  guns with or without magwells can’t be used as advertised. Gun racks are useless Limited vertical clearance, 2 additional inches of height are needed. Who designed this product (Vaultek MX safe)?

The device itself is built well. The programming process is an absolute nightmare that needs to be corrected. Initial prints are a nightmare and follow ups are all confusing with the device and light sequences very confusing. I am a pilot that fly complex systems and I had trouble from.the start trying to program it. There needs to be a more intuitive system for setup. Doesn't have to be that confusing. The device is hit or miss on programming as well. It just doesn't play nice. Sorry guys I like the device but the programming needs to be redesigned.

The product and safe itself is very nice and constructed well. The only issue I found was the terrible shipping package. No padding, or protection at all. Just a plastic bag poorly wrapped around the product box. I reached out to Vaultek and expressed my concerns, and in a their response they stated the reason was due to cost alone. I understand that and all, but still find that unacceptable. I’d gladly pay a bit more to insure my purchase arrives damage free. But again: Very nice safe, and I’d recommend Vaultek to my family and friends.

Wifi functionality does not work.I tried calling support and was disconnecting during the process - no call back. During the process, they were trying to get me to reduce the security protocols on my router to get the safe to connect, which seems like a massive red flag.

I purchased the Vaultek 2.0.  It's well made and will hopefully fit my needs.  However, after purchasing I learned how easy it was to defeat the locking mechanism and box.  After setting up the biometrics with my fingerprint I had issues opening the lock.  This was during a cold period in Colorado.  Not sure if the cold had something to do with the lock not recognizing my fingerprint.

Review.Titre: I originally tried ordering this safe…
Review.Contenu: I originally tried ordering this safe on the website but the site kept locking up and I couldn’t complete my order. The item was out of stock immediately upon getting back in stock. Then I finally ordered the safe months later and the fingerprint pad doesn’t work more than a day. I’ve reset my print 5 times and none of them last. I hope I never need to get to my gun in an emergency.

Review.Titre: Nice design, hard to get the biometrics right
Review.Contenu: I love the design of the safe, I like the wifi app, I like the idea of the biometric entry. The reason I say the idea of the biometric entry is that so far the biometric entry has been very finicky. I've reset the master fingerprints 3 times already and within a few days the biometric sensor won't give me access. My Mac with fingerprint sensing works every time.

Review.Titre: I ordered this organizer but wasn’t…
Review.Contenu: I ordered this organizer but wasn’t happy with it. It’s a good organizer, but I found the pockets very small for my needs. I won’t be using it in my safe. Maybe at my workbench.

The fingerprint scanner is too temperamental. I think the user should have the option for the keypad to stay lit in the dark so it’s easy to find. The USB charging ports should be positioned and faced so the cords are not coming out vertically. The LED screen is not very aesthetically pleasing at this price point. It looks like a 1980s radio clock. Allow some color customizations. At this price point you can buy two iPads with touch screens. Please rethink your screen. The Bluetooth nano button should be rechargeable or offer a plug in. It eats batteries like crazy. Overall I’ll keep it but there’s many ways to make this better.

Review.Titre: The lifepod 2.0 isn't deep enough to…
Review.Contenu: The lifepod 2.0 isn't deep enough to have both a handgun and the organizer tray installed. I bought it with the intention of using it to store a Glock 19 Gen 5. But, sadly, the tray will not fit with the handgun in the Lifepod 2.0.

1st the shipping box was torn up and pretty beat. I thought I was looking at the safe body, an inner box protected it very well. My biggest issues are I order the the wifi not knowing it won't work on a 5G network. Ya know must system in the modern world are 5G you must catch up. This was unknown to me and paid extra for something I can't use now. Construction is solid  the electronics are sluggish. Delayed. Bio metrics are slow as well. The actual opening when used is not the best however never used one before with Bio metrics.

Haven’t received my product yet. Placed an order and it said in stock just to get an email saying that my order would ship in about a month.I’m hoping we’ll love the product when we get it but overall experience was subpar given the back order mistake on the website.

The wrong safe was sent, I contacted them and they sent a replacement.  They said a shipping label and a shipping bag would be with the replacement but there was no shipping bag so I waited a week until I got a delivery from Amazon before sending it back.

Review.Titre: If you’re gonna put that much into a…
Review.Contenu: If you’re gonna put that much into a safe that potentially sits on your nightstand, an alarm clock addition to that would be suited.  I ordered this safe and it is nice and does have a lot of features, but I assumed that it came as an alarm clock as well.

Review.Titre: Travel wells but lacks quick access.
Review.Contenu: Delivery, customer service/satisfaction Vaultek Safe is great.  The product is good, but I found the Lifepod 2.0 good not great/expected.   The Lifepod 2.0 is great as far as a small (almost too small still) pelican like case.  It's like having a sleeve for your pc not a bag.  A major negative for me was the latches have to be clamped and the the lid has no spring in/to it.  Definitely, not a quick access storage option.  But absolutely a good travel option.  And I was also disappointed with the service discount at 5%.

Review.Titre: Great safe with room for improvement
Review.Contenu: The safe is great! The fingerprint reading is superb. The design is neat and compact. The newer or bigger/heavier models were not available for weeks/months and I had to settle for the RS500i.However (RS500i):1. Incredibly dangerous to have it unsecured if you have inquisitive kids as it's very unstable and can topple over very easily. You are almost forced to have to buy a separate base to prevent it from falling over.If you have baseboard molding, securing it to the wall it's tricky. Not to mention that the only way to secure it onto the wall requires unscrewing several sets of tiny fragile screws that strip very very easily. You can screw it into the floor but not ideal for many homeowners.2. Could use more lightning and have options for the lighting to remain on for much longer. The light stays on for an insanely short amount of time. I would still buy it again because it's just an excellent option for confined spaces and the technology is great and reliable.
Customer service was good dealing with my issue but haven't returned my full refund and been 2 weeks since I reached out to them . . .

#1complaint-Made in ChinaThe safe is decent, as is the carry bag. #2 complaint is you can only store a micro under the accessories tray. If you have a larger hand gun it has to sit on top the accessory tray.
If it misses your finger print read once it puts it self in tamper mode an then have to use the code so thats concerning

Review.Titre: Nice safe but irritating wireless charging
Review.Contenu: It's a nice safe with a lot of features, but I have two things I dislike. One is minor and one is irritating. The minor issues is you have to connect to your phone yo set the clock. I personally don't want my phone connected it should just be an option and not a must. I just disconnect it after so no bug deal. The irritating issue I have is the wireless charging. It's difficult finding the right spot to put your phone. You think you have it in the right place and everything says it's charging just to wake up and find your phone didn't charge. The wireless charging is such a hassle it makes it so I can't really recommend it to friends.

Review.Titre: I love the idea of this safe.
Review.Contenu: This may sound like a rant, but is a straight forward review. The wireless charger is an automatic star drop. It does not hold the phone in place and charges slow, It won’t charge AirPods with or without a case. Trying to put your phone on the wireless pad in the dark is tough. The second star knocked off is due to the fingerprint scanner. Programming is not the easiest which I’d let slide if it opened every time but it does not. Overall its a good safe but no longer my nightstand choice. Ill likely move it to the living room and look for something I feel more comfortable will open when I need it to.I will stick with Vaultek as they offer first responder and veteran discounts.The safe is built sturdy, the screen is meh. Might take a look at the 10 series.
The biometric feature is unreliable.  Other than that I am happy with it.

Review.Titre: Can’t use the tray and gun at the same time
Review.Contenu: Overall the product looks good. I paid extra to get the card holder and tray as I want to use this for traveling. I’m disappointed that I can’t have the tray and Glock 19 in at the same time. Only one or the other. Lid will not close with both inside.  Kinda defeats the purpose of buying all the accessories.

Review.Titre: The vaultech DS2i smart station is a…
Review.Contenu: The vaultech DS2i smart station is a nice product other than a few issues I’ve had with it. Firstly the finger scanner is not great you have to usually scan a couple times for it to work, it’s quicker to type in code. Secondly the door doesn’t slide all the way out when ejected and tracks on the sides  are pretty loose side to side lots of play when fully open, could be an issue longer down the line. Lastly the wireless charger on top is temperamental. It works fine some days, then other days its intermittent charging station keeps going on and off. In conclusion I like the station and the look, but price point at 500$ and all these issues with it, to me is not worth the money. If I had to do it again I probably would have went in a different direction.

Review.Titre: Bought the wifi version and it doesn’t…
Review.Contenu: Bought the wifi version and it doesn’t work using an eero 6 router. Fingerprint scanner is borderline unusable. I do like the safe in general though.

Review.Titre: Wifi options are great but there is a high cost that cones with compromises
Review.Contenu: The RS800i has some of the most advanced features on the market. However, the features do not match the high cost. I would expect stronger mounting options, thicker steel for the shell(the great door feels like its on a lunchbox), and Internal USB power for things like keeping tac lights fully charged for my Olight. (magnetic charger would be PERFECT... if I had USB power in there. I just dont want to hack my internals)The lack of competition in the WiFi-connected space is what pushed my purchase, coupled with good biometrics. The configurable internal nature is pretty nice, but again, not enough for the price. I am disappointed that the low-power mode when on battery basically stops communicating after the battery alert. (Mine was on battery for a week and the data hadnt changed) Hopefully the safe will at least alert to tamper/opening on battery.Im also disappointed that I have to pay an extra few hundred to get better storage like the extra shelf, etc. - why am I getting the biggest safe to have one shelf?Having an app to see temp/humidity/tamper and opening details is great, and honestly the industry needs to catch up. Somehow Vaultek hasnt made this standard for all its devices including the insanely expensive Smart clock model - its as though they dont understand what sets them apart.If you need to know the status of your vault at all times and want pings on your phone, the Vaultek RS series for your rifle/shotgun is your only real option, but be prepared to spend.

Review.Titre: DS2i Vaultek Safe Is Too Small ... Here's Why
Review.Contenu: Overall, I like the DS2i safe as it meets its primary design purpose in my eyes, which is to have a hidden (AKA disguised) safe which is also easily accessible and out in the open.  However, I am limited to what I can store in the safe, specifically the following common handguns do not allow the drawer to close: (a) 1911 with ambidextrous safety levers, (b) SIG P320 with a slightly flared (after-market) mag well (c), a .44 magnum revolver and (d) an 8-shot .357 magnum revolver.  If the safe was just 1/4" greater in thickness, I feel all my handguns would be accommodated.  Additionally, almost any of my handguns, except for the likes of a SIG P365, will greatly slow the opening of the drawer such that it does not fully open.  Even with my SIG P365, the drawer just does not open fully or robustly.  My sincere message to Vaultek is for this safe to be redesigned like this: (1) increase the depth by at least 1/4" and (2) use a more powerful drawer opening mechanism.  I recognize that new design/issued products often go through an evolution process based on real-world consumer feedback; I wish I had waited a few years to buy this safe.

Review.Titre: The Ds2i is a nice safe overall
Review.Contenu: The Ds2i is a nice safe overall. I like the screen is easy to read but does not light up my room when the lights are all out. It is a long safe and did have trouble making room on my night stand while also being able to read it, but I can't fault Vaultek as it does fit a 92FS and a mag with plenty of room. My biggest issue is the charging pad. It is a nice thought but there have been many times I have to re-center the phone because it will not charge or wake up to an almost dead phone. For almost $500 I would expect a better effort or to remove it completely. The nano was easy to set up and the biometrics and pin work fine.

Review.Titre: Doesnt hardly fit full size pistols…
Review.Contenu: Doesnt hardly fit full size pistols like it says it does. The foam inserts peel out of the pistol rack way too easily, the zippers are cheap. Don’t get me wrong, I love the case. It’s just not in any way worth $600. This case should be half that price. It’s unfortunate that it’s the only thing on the market that has the features it has. No other brand offers the same modularity, tether, and biometric features. It’s sad that I had to buy this. They don’t even include the battery. I would really love to give this case 1 star since they’ve emailed me 5 times in the last week to “remind me” to write a review. So here ya go.All in all, best case I own. Ridiculously overpriced. $329.99 would be a reasonable price for this case. And I’ll bet they can do that too and still make money.

Nice Safe. I got lucky and found one on the site. The DS2i arrived quickly and in good packaging.Pros: The safe looks great and is covert. The app lets you customize functionality i.e. fingerprints, volume and interior light. Has a charging pad for your phone, the door is spring-loaded and slides smoothly and the quality is good. The number pad only had four numbers on it and I believe that is good enough for quick access.Cons: The fingerprint sensor is like most sensors where you might need to try a couple of times for it to register your latent. Saving a few latent prints from each hand in case of emergency. The charger does not work well as it is difficult to get the phone centered on the charger.Overall: The safe is nice but not at $500 especially since the wireless phone charging pad doesn't work well. For quick access this safe is nice but I also bought it specifically because of the wireless phone charging feature built into the nightstand safe. I am thinking about returning it if Vaultek can't guarantee that they can fix the issue with my safe.

Review.Titre: I love the safe aspect of it but kinda…
Review.Contenu: I love the safe aspect of it but kinda of upsetting it doesn’t have a actual alarm clock also the wireless charging is iffy and sometimes makes random beeps

I really like the customization. But my safe messed up a few times already and wouldn’t close correctly. It said “locked” but it was not locked. And my remote button does not open my safe when I want to. It’ll do it when I first hook it up then the next day it won’t work or it says it needs to be activated again. That was one of the main reasons for my purchase..

Review.Titre: I'm having issues with opening the…
Review.Contenu: I'm having issues with opening the door. It does not release most of time and I have to punch the top of the door with the heal of my hand as it tries to open to let it release. NOT GOOD! To have it not open immediately in an emergency and have to do the code repeatedly to open is scary.

Review.Titre: Overall Smart Safe 2.0 is decent, but should have more functionality and better components for the price.
Review.Contenu: I’m amending my rating of the Smart Safe. I was struggling to figure out how to use the app (the app itself doesn’t explain how to set pin), but eventually figured it out. Still need to ding the safe for two reasons:1. You shouldn’t need to use their app to simply set the time. That’s a mistake. Also, the app is not straight forward and they need to make it clearer.2. The thermometer on my unit is off by 5 degrees.It’s a cool piece of tech but very expensive and should have fully onboard methods of setting time. Would be nice to include an alarm clock as well.

Review.Titre: The induction charger for the phone is squirrely
Review.Contenu: The induction charger for the phone is touchy.  If not placed PERFECTLY, it will start beeping.  Sometimes it starts beeping much later (read as, while asleep).

Overall, I like the safe. My one disappointment is the fact that I can't use it for the reason I purchased it. I have a Sig P320, and when I placed it in the safe, the case that comes with it wouldn't fit. I bought this version for that feature and I can't even use it.

Review.Titre: I still don’t have my safe and my…
Review.Contenu: I still don’t have my safe and my humidor was delivered but without a bovida packet to season it. I’m sure the product is great. Customer service is neutral at best

Review.Titre: The wireless phone charger on the top…
Review.Contenu: The wireless phone charger on the top of the unit is draining my phone completely overnight. It is not functioning properly.
It is a nice safe.  But the low battery alarm does not come on even when selected and a thump print stops working right away. And you cannot open it from the app.

Review.Titre: Well I’m not too picky but it was a…
Review.Contenu: Well I’m not too picky but it was a bummer that the was a mix up in the ordering process cause there’s been a delay. But other than that it’s fine

Review.Titre: The safe is giving me troubles opening
Review.Contenu: The safe is giving me troubles opening. I put my code on and it makes the noise like it's going to open... and it dosent. I have to do it over and over many times and some times have to hit the door to make it open. NOT HAPPY! Don't get me wrong, it's a really nice safe but now has an annoining problem.

Review.Titre: I was under the impression that my…
Review.Contenu: I was under the impression that my Glock 20 10mm would fit with a smaller Sig Sauer 365. Problem is the tray does not work with the Glock. And the tray I was counting on for extra items and mags. Seems like a great product though.
For the larger safe, I was disappointed that a full size pistol cannot fit with the additional plastic piece for accessories.

Review.Titre: Amazing Safe will not fit Sig P226 x5
Review.Contenu: Amazing Safe Unfortunately it doesn’t fit my gun,SIG P226 X5. Safety hits. Will not spring open with a heavy gun loaded with clips.I had to cut padding to get safe to close.

Review.Titre: I do not like the custom inserts for inside and top shelf, but overall worked out how I wanted it
Review.Contenu: I do not like the custom inserts for inside. Seems like mag inserts should be on the left and gun inserts on the right for better draw. Had to remove top pull out shelf because there was not enough room for two handguns to fit in bottom inserts correctly without bumping into top shelf, 2 inches more clearance on safe would fix issue. Also when I still had the top shelf pull out drawer in, mags and guns slid around easily when opening and closing, should be padded to help prevent issue. Overall I got two handguns inside with 3 extra mags each, and a spot for two 10 round mags for mag fed shotgun, so it accomplished what I was hoping for
The fingerprint scan does not consistently work. Also, arrived slightly scuffed on the front of the door.
Decent product, bag is very small, looks way smalley in person that in photos.

Review.Titre: Connection to Wi-Fi has not been…
Review.Contenu: Connection to Wi-Fi has not been successful yet, still troubleshooting, otherwise a great product

Review.Titre: It state that's its in stock
Review.Contenu: It state that's its in stock. Why do it take so long to ship? Other companies ships right away. Processing should be as fast as they take your money.

Review.Titre: Nano key will not pair with nsl20i
Review.Contenu: Nano key will not pair with nsl20i safe! The website should make it more clear which safes are nano key compatible.
Cannot get fingerprint to work, have cleared and tried multiple times

Review.Titre: The safe was shipped in a plastic bag
Review.Contenu: The safe was shipped in a plastic bag! lots of damages to the product box! Product works fine so far and no apparent damage but it's most likely not good for the electronics... I was about to order the Lifepod XT Colion Noir edition but now I'm afraid it will be shipped in the same condition...

Good item, bought it as a gift for my girlfriend. She liked it. However, the logistics took too long to get here. Fist they said the 7th, then the date changed to the 4th. For whatever reason, my package sat in limbo for 3-4 days in one location (which was relatively close to me, so that was frustrating). Overall, I want to order another but skeptical on it either taking all millennia to receive it or it being lost in shipment altogether.

Got my new Lifepod 2.0. My comments are as follows. I like the size and the various options to customize the inside to fit your needs. The safe is large enough to hold two pistols if desired or one pistol with extra clips and a box of ammo. Now the not so good. I paid extra for the biometric feature. I’ve programmed it several times now. It recognizes my fingerprints immediately after it is programmed. However, if I wait a few hours or even the next day the unit will not recognize my fingerprint and I have to use the four digit code. I’m on my fifth try but my guess is that as your hand expands and contracts with how warm your hand is, so does your fingerprint slightly enough to cause the unit not to function as it should. Secondly, if you have to get into the safe quickly that isn’t possible either. If you depend on the biometrics in the middle of the night then have to switch to the four digit code that takes longer then you also have to use both hands to unlatch the security latches on either side which creates noise with the latches. Then you have to manually open the lid. It does not pop up on its own. Overall I think the safe is built well but just not as quick access as I would like as I wanted it to keep by my bedside in case of emergency with an intruder. Personally I would not purchase this item again or recommend it. The advertisement is deceiving on how easily the biometrics work and how easy access is.

Pretty basic. I bought a refurbished one. I’m glad the Barricade model I got has a keypad along with biometric finger scanner. The biometric works about every third attempt. Wouldn’t bet my life on it. Works great to keep kids out. The inside light works good. Sometimes use the steel cable if I go somewhere. Keeps honest people honest. Fits a compact and subcompact at the same time nicely.

Review.Titre: You better have a skinny firearm
Review.Contenu: I really wanted to love this safe, but it falls short for one reason - it’s too shallow. I got the safe/bag combo, with the tray. However, the tray is absolutely useless if you have a mid-size or full-size firearm because the try will not fit or close when you put your firearm in the safe. Unless you have a thin and/or 1911 style firearm, don’t bother getting the tray. The rest of the safe is of good quality, as well as the bag. Although when you put the safe in it, you’re not gonna fit much of anything else in there. I’m just very disappointed with the tray issue.

Review.Titre: Not all 10 series are made the same, be careful
Review.Contenu: I almost purchased the base 10 series model thinking that it had dual latches. All of the marketing, to include the product description on their buy page talks about the dual latch system. I didn't need the tech updates but wanted the dual latch. I found out on other sites that this is not the case, and reached out to support for clarification. They did end up providing me with a discount on the upgraded model and indicated they were working on updating the website to reduce confusion. It still does not appear to have been updated after two weeks though.

Review.Titre: Hard to review a product you have not…
Review.Contenu: Hard to review a product you have not received yet.

A little disappointed.  The overall construction of the LifePod 2.0 is fantastic.  The major flaw is that you are not able to use the tray insert when you have a pistol stored in the pod.  Just add about 3/4" to an inch and all will be good.

Review.Titre: Pistol hangs up when pulling from safe
Review.Contenu: Pistol hangs up when pulling from safe. safe needs to be a half inch longer to better access standard 911 pistols or Springfield XD. Safe quality and entry options very good. Just disappointed on how you have to turn and pull pistol out. Makes noise which I don't like, squeals.

Review.Titre: Great safe but too darn expensive

Review.Contenu: I purchased a RS500i from a third party not being available from Vaultek. Safe seems good but some of the features seems too much.  The WiFi at times disconnects and it is also tricky because you need to buy all these accessories. All the parts were not in the safe I only received 2 Barrel adapter and no velcro barrel mount.
